sentences.en: As a result Heath rarely exhibited Nixon's crippling diffidence.
sentences.cn: 因此,希思很少表现出尼克松那种郁郁寡欢.

sentences.en: Few kinds of plants grow in the heath.
sentences.cn: 少有植物可在荒地上生长.

sentences.en: For all his failings , Ted Heath was not stupied.
sentences.cn: 爱德华·希思有不少缺点,但他并不愚蠢.

sentences.en: For all his failings, Ted Heath was not stupid.
sentences.cn: 爱德华?希思有不少缺点, 但他并不愚蠢.

sentences.en: Great play was made with how Mr. Heath had forecast economic disaster.
sentences.cn: 他们大肆渲染希恩先生怎样预见经济危机.

sentences.en: He decided to cut across the Heath, through Greenwich Park.
sentences.cn: 他决定抄近路走格林尼治公园穿过希思区。

sentences.en: He had been Chief Whip for many years under Mr. Heath.
sentences.cn: 多年来,他一直是希思手下的督导员.

sentences.en: He had exulted in Heath's unexpected victory in 1970.
sentences.cn: 希思一九七○年意外获胜使他非常高兴.

sentences.en: Heath wrote us a letter friendly in tone, sparse in content.
sentences.cn: 希思给我们写了一封语调友善 、 内容空泛的信.

sentences.en: Heath's appeal against the sentence was later successful.
sentences.cn: 希思对判决不服提出上诉，后来胜诉了。

sentences.en: Mr. Heath had inspired their affection as well as their respect.
sentences.cn: 希思先生能赢得他们的爱戴和尊敬.

sentences.en: The noise of the wind over the heath was shrill.
sentences.cn: 吹过荒原的狂风,声音那样尖锐.

sentences.en: This feather was picked up from the heath, the bird was not shot: we saw its nest in the winter, full of little skeletons.
sentences.cn: 这根毛是从石南丛生的荒地里拾的，这只鸟儿没打中：我们在冬天看见过它的窝的，满是小骨头。

sentences.en: This must have been sometning of a blow for Mr. Heath.
sentences.cn: 对于希思先生,这可以说是当头一棒.

sentences.en: To be fair, he never enjoyed good relations with Edward Heath.
sentences.cn: 说句公道话, 他和爱德华·希思的关系从来就不算好.

trans.tran_cn: 荒地，荒野，[植]石南，杜鹃花科植物
trans.tran_en: a large open area, usually with sandy soil and scrubby vegetation, esp heather
